title: Jurgen Klopp backs Liverpool to respond to Southampton defeat with "brave" display against Manchester United
text:
Sport Jurgen Klopp backs Liverpool to respond to Southampton defeat with "brave" display against Manchester United The Reds were beaten 1-0 in the EFL Cup semi-final first leg after being held by Plymouth last weekend and Klopp wants a performance from his players at Old Trafford Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Jurgen Klopp speaks ahead of Manchester United trip Share this video Get daily   Could   
Jurgen Klopp has challenged his players to bounce back from their midweek defeat to Southampton. 
Liverpool were beaten 1-0 in the EFL Cup semi-final first leg after being held by Plymouth last weekend. 
Klopp expects his players to respond and has urged them to be brave against Manchester United, reports the Liverpool Echo. 
“When I woke up this morning I thought ‘yes, only two days to go’,” Klopp said. 
“It’s all good. I hear in your questions that because of our last game it’s ‘oh my God, now it’s Man United’ and all that stuff. Nathan Redmond celebrates scoring in midweek (Photo: PA) Klopp during his press conference (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty Images) 
“But give me 11 players and we will be competitive. These are my players. We already know a lot about each other. I know how they react to a not so good performance. 
“That last game doesn’t make us weaker for this game, it should make us stronger. 
“It’s not about being confident before the game, it’s about getting confidence in the game with the right movements, right kind of defending and right kind of causing them problems. 
“If the last game gives us some extra greed, like wanting to fix something then welcome, use it.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
